page.title: 10Traveller's Fare.
page.content: Today as in the past all the travellers which use the road through Tempsford require food drink and shelter.One advantage to the village of the A1 is the amount of trade it brings to the village inns. Tempsford once had 4 inns today only 3 survive the {Wheatsheaf }and the {White Hart} which cater for the local trade and the rather impressive {Anchor Inn } which captures the tourist trade. On the site of the Anchor was a much earlier inn named the Oar & Boy . The boy was supposed to row people over the river at the rear of the inn grounds.The Anchor was a great coaching inn built some time in the 17thC.Its prime position on the fording point of the Great North Road ensured healthy trade,today excellent food and five real ales on offer maintains this trade.
